w:r.w:t: The teacher will teach how to be a good citizen by using TPR, sentence frames, and vocabulary. Students will study these words and phrases:
At completion of this lesson, students will be able to:
Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words related to being a good citizen
Spell and pronounce common associated words
Use sets of words in complete sentences
Word List: citizen, homework, best, help, laws
This slide will always be the Naativ-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: “Today, we are going to be learning about being a good citizen!”

Underline the bold phrase and say it. Have the child repeat. Circle the picture of the figure loving the Earth. Tell the child that he loves where he lives. Circle the picture of the man “cleaning” the earth. This figure cares about the earth. Briefly explain that they are
Circle the boy and tell the student that he is a
while giving a thumbs-up. Explain some simple things he does (underline the phrases as you mention them), like
See if student understands by doing an action for these phrases.
Circle these places and say them. Explain that we need to be a good citizen (give a thumbs-up) in all of these places.
I need to do my homework
Circle the picture of the girl working at home. Tell the child she is at home. Circle the work on the table and say
I need to do my homework
while pretending to write and have the child repeat.
in the white space and have the child repeat.
I need to play with my brother.
Circle the picture of the bigger boy. Say,
He is playing with his brother.
I need to play with my brother
and have the child repeat the phrase.
I need to clean my room
Circle the boy sweeping. Explain that he is doing a good job (give a thumbs-up).
I need to clean my room
while pretending to sweep and have the child repeat.
I am a good citizen when I clean my room/do my homework/play with my brother.
Circle the red, white and blue boy. Explain that he is a good citizen while giving a thumbs-up.
I am a good citizen when I clean my room
by first circling the red, white and blue boy and then circling the picture of the boy cleaning. Encourage the child to say the last two phrases the same way.
Circle the boy’s hand and say,
and do the action. Have the child repeat.
Circle the blond boy who is helping the other boy. Explain that this is a good and kind thing. This helps you be a good citizen.
while reaching out a helping hand and have the child repeat.
I need to do my best
Circle the A+ and give a thumbs-up. Simply explain that she did a GOOD job on her work. Circle the word,
and say it. Then circle the A+ to make the connection that a A+ is her best.
I need to do my best
with a thumbs-up and have the child repeat.
I am a good citizen when I listen, do my best, help others
Circle the red, white and blue boy. Explain that he is a good citizen while giving a thumbs-up.
I am a good citizen when I listen
by first circling the red, white and blue boy and then circling the picture of the boy listening. Encourage the child to say the last two phrases the same way.
Draw a line from the place we are good citizens to the activity
Model drawing a line from the A+ student to the school. Say,
I need to do my best at school
while circling the girl when you say the word,
Encourage the child to finish the last two pictures the same way.
Circle the picture of the stoplight. Explain that this is a
Briefly explain that we HAVE to look and pay attention to these stoplights. Circle the crosswalk. Explain that we have to cross in these safe areas.
I need to pick up trash
Circle the girl picking up trash and say,
I need to pick up trash
while doing the action of pretending to pick up trash.
Circle the recycling symbol and say the word
I am a good citizen when I pick up trash/obey the laws/recycle
Circle the red, white and blue boy. Explain that he is a good citizen while giving a thumbs-up.
I am a good citizen when I pick up trash
by first circling the red, white and blue boy and then circling the picture of the girl picking up trash. Encourage the child to say the last two phrases the same way.
I can be a good citizen at/in my home/school/neighborhood.
Name one way you can be good in each place.
I can be a good citizen at/in my home.
Have the child repeat. Repeat the phrase with the other two places.
Circle the home. Say one of the good things we can do at home such as
I need to clean my room.
Circle the next picture and encourage the child to say something good we can do in that place. Finish the neighborhood picture the same way.
Discuss how these two people are good citizens
and give a thumbs-up. Encourage the child to say,
Encourage the child to say why they are good citizens. Have a short discussion.
